dct_title_s: Map showing lower Brule Agency South Dakota
dct_description_sm: Hand-drawn lithographed map, text in script, one section colored in outline.

Includes names and locations of several headmen, including Chief Iron Horse who died in 1894. Others are: Left Hand Thunder; Jos. Bites off; Chas. Ellis (latter listed as "herder" and salaried employee of the Bureau in its 1892 report)
Shows various buildings: ice house, stable, doctor's house, school, &c. &c.
Missouri River is shown as the N. N. E. boundary.
Printed in the bottom lower right: S Ex 51 1, shorthand for Senate Exec. Doc. 51st Cong. 1st session?
dct_creator_sm: United States, Bureau of Indian Affairs.
United States, Office of Indian Affairs., Lower Brulé Agency.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Map Collections courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact Branner Earth Sciences Library & Map Collections at brannerlibrary@stanford.edu.
